name: Change of Control
response:
### Change of Control and Rights Affected

A "Change of Control" is defined as occurring when any person or group, who did not previously control the Issuer, acquires more than 50% of the voting rights in the Issuer[1][2]. In the event of a Change of Control, the Issuer may choose to redeem or procure the purchase of all, but not some only, of the Notes on the Change of Control Call Date at their principal amount together with any accrued interest and any Arrears of Interest, including any Additional Interest Amounts[3][4].

### Change of Control Period

The "Change of Control Period" begins on the earlier of the first public announcement by the Issuer of the occurrence of the relevant Change of Control or the date of the Potential Change of Control, and ends 90 calendar days after the first public announcement of the effective occurrence of such Change of Control[5][6].

### Change of Control Event

A "Change of Control Event" occurs if a Change of Control and a Change of Control Rating Downgrade happen within the Change of Control Period[3][4].

### Change of Control Rating Downgrade

A "Change of Control Rating Downgrade" is deemed to have occurred if, within the Change of Control Period, the rating assigned to the Issuer by any solicited Rating Agency is withdrawn, changed from an investment grade to a non-investment grade, or lowered by at least one full rating notch if it was already below investment grade[7][8].

### Issuer's Obligations

In the event of a Change of Control Event, the Issuer must inform the Noteholders within 30 calendar days, specifying the circumstances and either the date of redemption or purchase of the Notes (the "Change of Control Call Date") or the Issuer's election not to redeem or procure purchase of the Notes. Redemption or purchase will occur not less than 10 nor more than 60 calendar days after the Change of Control Notice is given[9][10].

### Interest Rate Adjustment

If the Issuer does not exercise its option to redeem the Notes following a Change of Control Event, the prevailing Interest Rate on the Notes will be increased by an additional margin of 5.00% per annum (the "CoC Step-Up Margin") effective from the earlier of the date of the Change of Control Notice or the 30th calendar day following the occurrence of a Change of Control Event, until the final redemption of the Notes[9][10].

name: Event of Default
response:
### Circumstances of Issuer's Failure to Fulfill Obligations

The Notes do not provide for events of default or cross default that would allow for the acceleration of the Notes if certain events occur. If the Issuer fails to meet any obligations under the Notes, including the payment of any interest, or is in default under other indebtedness, investors will not have the right to require the early redemption of principal. The sole remedy available to Noteholders for recovery of amounts owing in respect of any payment of principal or interest on the Notes will be the institution of proceedings to enforce such payment[1].

### Immediate Payment Circumstances

Each Note shall become immediately due and payable at its principal amount, together with accrued interest thereon, if any, to the date of payment and any Arrears of Interest, in the event that a judgment is rendered by any competent court declaring the judicial liquidation of the Issuer, or in the event of a transfer of the whole of the business of the Issuer subsequent to the opening of a judicial recovery procedure, or in the event of a voluntary dissolution of the Issuer or if the Issuer is liquidated for any other reason[2].

citations.reference_text: There are no events of default or cross default under the Notes Unlike unsubordinated debt securities of the Issuer, the Terms and Conditions of the Notes do not provide for events of default or cross default allowing acceleration of the Notes if certain events occur. Accordingly, if the Issuer fails to meet any obligations under the Notes, including the payment of any interest, or is in default under other indebtedness, investors will not have the right to require the early redemption of principal. Upon a payment default, the sole remedy available to Noteholders for recovery of amounts owing in respect of any payment of principal or interest on the Notes will be the institution of proceedings to enforce such payment.

However, each Note shall become immediately due and payable at its principal amount, together with accrued interest thereon, if any, to the date of payment and any Arrears of Interest (including any Additional Interest Amounts thereon), in the event that a judgement is rendered by any competent court declaring the judicial liquidation (liquidation judiciaire) of the Issuer, or in the event of a transfer of the whole of the business of the Issuer (cession totale de l'entreprise) subsequent to the opening of a judicial recovery procedure (redressement judiciaire), or in the event of a voluntary dissolution of the Issuer or if the Issuer is liquidated for any other reason (and in all cases listed above, other than pursuant to a consolidation, amalgamation or merger or other reorganization outside the context of an insolvency whereby the surviving entity assumes all obligations of the Issuer under the Notes).

name: Permitted Indebtedness
response:
### Additional Debt and Guarantees

There is no restriction in the Terms and Conditions of the Notes on the amount of debt which the Issuer may issue or guarantee nor any negative pledge provisions. The Issuer and its subsidiaries and affiliates may incur additional indebtedness or grant guarantees in respect of indebtedness of third parties, including indebtedness or guarantees that rank pari passu or senior to the Notes. The issue of any such securities or the incurrence of any such other liabilities may reduce the amount recoverable by Noteholders on a winding-up of the Issuer and/or may increase the likelihood of a deferral of interest payments under the relevant Notes[1].

### Recent Debt Activities

Since 31 March 2024, the amount drawn under the Group's revolving credit facility increased by €350 million, short-term bank debt of €380 million was incurred, and NEU commercial paper outstanding increased by €5 million. This evolution reflects the Group's seasonality in terms of cash flows and is in line with the Group's cash forecasts[2].

name: Optional Redemption
response:
### Redemption Upon Change of Control

In the event of a Change of Control, the Issuer may, at its option, redeem all, but not some only, of the Notes on the Change of Control Call Date at their principal amount together with any accrued interest and any Arrears of Interest (including any Additional Interest Amounts thereon)[1].

### Redemption for Taxation Reasons

If a Tax Deductibility Event occurs, the Issuer may, at its option, redeem all of the Notes at any time, subject to having given not more than sixty (60) nor less than ten (10) calendar days' prior notice to the Noteholders. The redemption will be at the Early Redemption Price if it occurs before the First Call Date or at their principal amount together with any accrued interest and any Arrears of Interest on or after the First Call Date[2].

### Redemption at the Option of the Issuer

The Issuer has the right to redeem all of the Notes on any date during the period commencing on 29 May 2029 and ending on the First Reset Date, on the First Step-Up Date, or upon any Interest Payment Date after the First Step-Up Date. This is subject to having given not more than sixty (60) nor less than ten (10) calendar days' prior notice to the Noteholders. The redemption will be made at their principal amount together with any accrued interest and Arrears of Interest[3].

### Use of Proceeds

The proceeds from the issuance of the Notes will be utilized as follows: approximately €1.2 billion will be used to repay by September 2024 Neu CP of approximately €1.03 billion and RCF drawings of €175 million. The remainder will be invested in highly liquid short-term investments, treated as cash equivalents, and earmarked for gross debt reduction at maturity[1][2].

### Deleveraging Plan

The Issuer presented a €2 billion inorganic deleveraging plan on 8 May 2024, aimed at protecting the Group's "Investment Grade" rating. This plan includes divestments of approximately €700 million, the issuance of the Notes, and a capital increase with preferential subscription rights amounting to approximately €1 billion, to be executed no later than September 2024, subject to market conditions and AMF approval. The net proceeds from the issue of the Notes are estimated at approximately €744 million and are part of this deleveraging plan[2].

name: Covenants
response:
### Covenant Provisions

The bond document outlines specific covenant provisions related to the determination of interest rates in the event that the Independent Adviser fails to establish a Successor Mid-Swap Rate or an Alternative Mid-Swap Rate. In such cases, the interest rate for the next reset period will be determined by fallback provisions, potentially resulting in the application of a fixed rate[1]. Additionally, there are provisions regarding the payment of Arrears of Interest and Additional Interest Amounts, which specify conditions under which partial payments may be made[2].

### Optional Partial Payment Arrears Interest Additional Interest Amounts

The covenant regarding optional partial payment of arrears interest and additional interest amounts outlines a specific order of payment. Firstly, all unpaid amounts of arrears of interest must be settled before any additional interest amounts are paid. Furthermore, arrears of interest accrued for any period are not payable until full payment has been made for all arrears of interest accrued during any earlier period. The payment order of additional interest amounts follows that of the arrears of interest to which they relate. Additionally, the amount payable in respect of any notes for any period is proportional to the total amount of all unpaid arrears of interest or additional interest amounts accrued on the notes for that period up to the date of payment[3].

### Notice Deferral Payment Arrears Interests

The covenant concerning notice deferral payment of arrears interests requires that notice of any deferral of interest under the notes on any interest payment date, as well as any date upon which amounts in respect of arrears of interest (including any additional interest amounts) become due and payable, must be given to the noteholders in accordance with Condition 10. This notice must also be provided to the Fiscal Agent and the Calculation Agent at least five business days, but no more than thirty business days, prior to the interest payment date or due date. The notice is irrevocable. If the notes are admitted to trading on Euronext Paris and the applicable rules require it, notice of any deferral must also be given to the stock exchange as soon as reasonably practicable[4].

name: The Offering
response:
### Terms and Conditions of the Notes

The issue of the €750,000,000 Undated Deeply Subordinated Fixed to Reset Rate NC 5.25 Notes (the "Notes") of Alstom has been authorized pursuant to a resolution of the Board of Directors dated 7 May 2024 and a decision of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer dated 23 May 2024[1].

### Issue Date and Form

The Notes are issued on 29 May 2024 in dematerialized bearer form in the denomination of €100,000 each. Title to the Notes will be evidenced by book-entries in accordance with Articles L.211-3 et seq. and R.211-1 et seq. of the French Code monétaire et financier[2].

### Agency Agreement

The Issuer has entered into an agency agreement dated 24 May 2024 with Uptevia, as fiscal agent and principal paying agent. The fiscal agent, the principal paying agent, and the paying agents are collectively referred to as the "Agents"[3].

### Calculation Agency Agreement

The Issuer has entered into a calculation agency agreement dated 24 May 2024 with Aether Financial Services as the calculation agent. Copies of the Agency Agreement and the Calculation Agency Agreement are available for inspection during usual business hours at the specified office of the Fiscal Agent and at the registered office of the Issuer[4].

### Registration and Transfer

The Notes will be inscribed in the books of Euroclear France, which shall credit the accounts of the Account Holders. Title to the Notes shall be evidenced by entries in the books of Account Holders and will pass upon registration of the transfer in such books[5].
